body.p: Suppose the results indicate that the null hypothesis should be rejected; thus, it is possible that a type I error has been committed.
Given the type of error made in this situation, what could researchers do to reduce the risk of this error?

input.choice: Choose a 0.01 significance level instead of a 0.05 significance level.

response.feedback: Correct. They could choose a 0.01 significance level instead of a 0.05 significance level, which would decrease the chance of making a type I error from 5 percent to 1 percent.
Incorrect. Increasing sample size would be the best way to reduce the chance of making a type II error, however, this is a type I error.

body.p: A researcher wants to avoid making a type I error. Which of the following actions would be the most effective in reducing the risk of a type I error?

response.feedback: Incorrect. If he chooses an alpha level of 0.05, he has a 5% chance of making a type I error. However, if he chooses a lower alpha level, it will lower his chance of making a type I error.
Correct. He could choose a 0.01 significance level instead of a 0.05 significance level, which would decrease the chance of making a type I error from 5% to 1%.
Incorrect. Increasing sample size would be the best way to reduce the chance of making a type II error. However, this is reducing the risk for a type I error.
